definition[0]: a large area of sea partly enclosed by land
definition[1]: a great difference and lack of understanding between two groups of people, especially in their beliefs, opinions, and way of life
example[1]: the huge gulf between management and unions
example[2]: a growing gulf between old and young
definition[2]: a brand of oil and petrol
definition[3]: a great difference or lack of understanding between two groups of people
example[3]: The South African Government must intervene to reduce the gulf between white wealth and black poverty.
definition[4]: a big difference between two amounts, levels etc
example[4]: The result is a 30% gulf between actual company hirings this year and projected hiring next year.
